intro: Grusonia bulbispina subsp. basileocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed grusonia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its bulbous root system and compact, herbaceous foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
